title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 201.15 - Petition to reopen hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 201.15 - Petition to reopen hearing

State Regulations

After the conclusion of a hearing but prior to the making of an order, a hearing
may, upon petition and in the discretion of the hearing officer, be reopen for the presentation of new evidence. Such petition to reopen the hearing
shall state in detail the nature of the new evidence, together with the reasons for the failure to submit such evidence prior to the conclusion of
the hearing. The hearing officer may, upon his or her own motion and upon reasonable notice to the parties, reopen a hearing for the presentation of
additional evidence. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
201.15

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
